title: (x) Junglist Movement - ITC Fenice {Yves}
content:
Put me out of my misery, I know I’m going to shout d’oh when someone gets it.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Junglist\_move.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20070403073701/http:/typophile.com/files/Junglist_move.jpg) | 9.03 KB |
author: byngo

comments.content: Now _that_ is a typical Aldo Novarese lc ‘g’ — lemmecheck…

[That’s what I thought](http://web.archive.org/web/20070403073701/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=ITC.119126.0.1&attributes.sampleSize=48&sampleText=Junglist+Movement&sampleSize=32). They added a stroke which made the contrast less and the serifs all blocky. Nasty… :^/

I’m afraid that’s a common strategy. One of my students, while we were discussing the weight differences in families, said “just throw a stroke on it in Illustrator and there’s your bold.” Of course, that comment triggered a huge lecture (and demonstration in Illustrator) that probably bored the pants off the whole class.
